Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: You can get more transparent than Github. Enron was technically transparent, but they used clever tools to obfuscate. If people don't understand or receive bad second/third hand info, it's not really transparent. You would need to understand code to see what progress is actually being made. We need people intimately familiar with the project to estimate progress.

Author: garbonzo607#4659

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: It doesn't guarantee anything though. It's transparent to people who can read code, take the initiative to read the code, and have the perception to notice all irregularities, which one person can't do, so it will always require multiple people, the more the better. Am I saying I have a solution to this? No. But I am saying that just because code is on Github doesn't make it transparent in the way many think of transparency. The code is public, but not 100% transparent. Again, there's not much Komodo can do about that right now, it's a problem for another day.

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content:
Just finished reading those links, JL. Great reads. The article that mentions how it's more important to make your ideas public and unrefined, but fast, rather than waiting around to refine your ideas in private really made an impression on me.

The one on OmiseGo is sad, as I had high hopes for OMG in 2017, but didn't buy any for exactly this reason. The lack of transparency and communication were red flags. But Komodo should fulfill OMG's promises if everything goes according to plan, right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not familiar with OMG promises

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: Basically a decentralized exchange capable of 1 million TPS where you can exchange one fiat currency, coin, or token, into another on the fly, seamlessly, from a mobile app. The dream was that if you had JPY and the merchant wanted USD, you could still pay the merchant with your JPY, and the merchant would receive USD, like nothing happened. Seems Komodo cross chain is similar, but you would need to exchange 20 minutes ahead of time. Which isn't quite as good but better than nothing.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: It wouldn't be a big deal for an exchange to accept deposits on multiple fungible chains for example
